_README: Copy this file, rename it to your_theme_id.json, and fill in the values. Delete this _README field when done.
description: A brief description of your theme for the theme selector
genre: fantasy | scifi | sports | mystery | professional | historical | other

layer_1_entities._description: Character and world nouns. Arrays allow random selection for variety.
friend: Supporting character(s) who help the hero
house: Sub-groups, teams, or divisions within school
location: Specific places within the world (e.g., 'the training ground')
place: Named locations students might visit (e.g., 'Downtown', 'The Lab')
creature: Entities students interact with (animals, robots, etc.)
pet: Companion creature with name (e.g., 'Rover the robot dog')
item: Tools or objects used in exercises
obstacle: Things that block progress (traps, defenders, errors)
danger_location: Risky places to enter (cave, danger zone, untested code)
busy_activity: Activities preventing rest (in combat, processing, playing)
basic_action: Simple action (basic attack, defend, try again)

layer_2_universal._description: Narrative building blocks used across all exercise types. These provide consistent voice and framing.
layer_2_universal.PROJECT_TYPE: What students build (e.g., 'enchanted system', 'starship module', 'game strategy')
layer_2_universal.SECTION_ICON: Emoji for section headers (e.g., sparkles, rocket, soccer ball)
layer_2_universal.CELEBRATION: Full celebration message when exercise completes
layer_2_universal.OPENING_FLAVOR: Opening line that sets the mood for exercises
layer_2_universal.CLOSING_FLAVOR: Closing line that wraps up exercises

layer_2_context_blocks._description: Full sentences/paragraphs that provide narrative context. Used by specific exercise templates.

introduction._description: Opening context for different exercise types
introduction.CONTEXT_ROLE_INTRO: Opening that assigns student a role

learning._description: What students will learn or achieve
learning.CONTEXT_PREDICTION_PURPOSE: Why prediction matters in this context
learning.CONTEXT_WORLD_VISION: What their completed world/system will do

narrative._description: Story elements that make exercises engaging
narrative.CONTEXT_INTERACTION_NARRATIVE: How entities relate to each other

tasks.CONTEXT_STUDENT_TASK: What the student needs to do
tasks.CONTEXT_ROLE_CHALLENGE: The problem they need to solve
tasks.CONTEXT_COMPARISON_DECISION: What decision needs to be made

completion._description: Messages when exercises or sections complete

quality._description: For code review and quality exercises

rivalry._description: For rivalry/showdown game exercises with defeat-training-victory arcs
rivalry.CONTEXT_SETBACK_NARRATIVE: Story explaining the defeat and what went wrong
rivalry.CONTEXT_CONFRONTATION_NARRATIVE: Story building to the climactic showdown

layer_2_indexed_blocks._description: Context blocks that repeat for multi-part exercises (phases, cases, stages). Use _N suffix where N is 1-5.

phases.CONTEXT_PHASE_N: Narrative for what phase N accomplishes

cases.CASE_N_TITLE: Title for case N (e.g., 'Bug #1: The Missing Key')
cases.CONTEXT_INVESTIGATION_PROMPT_N: Questions to guide debugging case N

layer_3_framework._description: Structural concepts that define how your universe works. Used in documentation and meta-descriptions.
layer_3_framework.INSTITUTION_TYPE: What kind of institution school is (e.g., 'academy', 'starship', 'agency')
layer_3_framework.CHALLENGE_TYPE: What obstacles are called (e.g., 'dark magic', 'system failures', 'opponents')

hybrid_exercise_blocks._description: For multi-part exercises that combine different exercise types in one narrative.
